Description: Solid rectangular spacer-bar of steatite: with traces of green glaze remaining, formed from a long bead, square in section. It is inscribed on upper and lower surfaces with the 'prenomen' of Amenemhat III. On the narrow sides is a crudely incised decoration of triangular shapes made by double zigzag lines. The bead is pierced longitudinally by one boring.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: H. R. H. Hall, ‘Catalogue of Egyptian Scarabs, etc. in The British Museum, vol. 1. Royal Scarabs’ (London, 1913), 15, no. 148.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (564)
